summary: Compares the base qualities of two SAM/BAM/CRAM files

arguments.summary: Undocumented option
arguments.name: [NA - Positional]

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and GELI).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: A configuration file to use with the GATK.
arguments.name: --gatk-config-file

arguments.summary: If the GCS bucket channel errors out, how many times it will attempt to re-initiate the connection
arguments.name: --gcs-max-retries

arguments.summary: Project to bill when accessing "requester pays" buckets. If unset, these buckets cannot be accessed.  User must have storage.buckets.get permission on the bucket being accessed.
arguments.name: --gcs-project-for-requester-pays

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: When writing SAM files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort a SAM file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: Summary output file.
arguments.name: --output

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --reference

arguments.summary: Round down quality scores to nearest quantized value.
arguments.name: --round-down-quantized
arguments.fulltext:
Round down quantized only works with the {@link #STATIC_QUANTIZED_QUALS_LONG_NAME} option.  If enabled,
 rounding is done in probability space to the nearest bin.  Otherwise, the value is rounded to the
 nearest bin that is smaller than the current bin.

 Note: this option only works when {@link #STATIC_QUANTIZED_QUALS_LONG_NAME} is set.

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: Use static quantized quality scores to a given number of levels (with --bqsr-recal-file)
arguments.name: --static-quantized-quals
arguments.fulltext:
Return value is 0 if the two files have identical base qualities and non-zero otherwise.
 Use static quantized quality scores to a given number of levels.

arguments.summary: Throw exception on difference.
arguments.name: --throw-on-diff

arguments.summary: Temp directory to use.
arguments.name: --tmp-dir

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkDeflater (as opposed to IntelDeflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-deflater

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkInflater (as opposed to IntelInflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-inflater

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --verbosity

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
Compares the base qualities of two SAM/BAM/CRAM files. The reads in the two files must have exactly the same names and appear in the same order. The two files are each specified without a flag. The tool summarizes the results in a text file.

Usage example

 gatk CompareBaseQualities \
   input_1.bam \
   input_2.bam \
   -O diff.txt

An example result with identical base qualities between two inputs

 -----------CompareMatrix summary------------
 all 10000 quality scores are the same

 ---------CompareMatrix full matrix (non-zero entries) ----------
 QRead1	QRead2	diff	count
 40	40	0	10000
 -----------CompareMatrix-binned summary------------
 all 10000 quality scores are the same

 ---------CompareMatrix-binned full matrix (non-zero entries) ----------
 QRead1	QRead2	diff	count
 40	40	0	10000
name: CompareBaseQualities
